TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
On DATE , the applicant was arrested and taken into police custody ( inverzekeringstelling ) on suspicion of trafficking drugs .

On DATE , after having heard the applicant , the investigating judge ( rechter - commissaris ) ordered the applicant ’s detention on remand ( inbewaringstelling ) for a period of DATE . The reasons stated by the investigating judge were :
“ It appears from the case - file that there are serious indications against the suspect ( there is more than a mere suspicion ) .
There are weighty reasons of public safety that warrant detention on remand , namely :

detention on remand is necessary because there exists a justified fear for recidivism : there is namely a substantial possibility that the suspect will commit an offence which , according to the legal definition , attracts a prison sentence of DATE or more ; ( there is fear for recidivism ) , which appears from the circumstance :
- that there are reasons to believe that the suspect is involved in drug trafficking , which trade is so lucrative that the suspect will be unable or unwilling to do without this source of income . ”
On DATE , after having heard the applicant , ORG ( arrondissementsrechtbank ) ordered the applicant ’s further detention on remand ( gevangenhouding ) for DATE , holding :

“ ORG considers that , after examination , it has appeared that the suspicion , indications and ground , which have led to the order for detention on remand ( bevel tot bewaring ) , currently still exist . ”
On DATE , after having heard the applicant , ORG prolonged the applicant ’s detention on remand by a further DATE . It held :

“ ORG considers that , after examination , it has appeared that the suspicion , indications and grounds , which have led to the order for the suspect ’s further detention on remand ( bevel gevangenhouding ) , currently still exist . ”

The applicant ’s appeal against the decision of DATE – in which he relied inter alia on the ORG ’s considerations in the case of PERSON v. GPE , ( judgment of DATE , Series A no . CARDINAL , p. CARDINAL , § CARDINAL ) – was rejected on DATE by the ‘ s - ORG ( gerechtshof ) . It upheld the impugned decision , holding :

“ considering that ORG concurs with the above - cited ruling and the grounds on which it is based , on the understanding that the [ applicant ’s ] pre - trial detention is also based on the following weighty reason of public safety , namely :

it concerns suspicion of a fact which , according to the legal definition , attracts a prison sentence of DATE or more and this fact has seriously rocked the legal order , consequently the appeal must be dismissed . ”

By judgment of DATE , following a hearing held on DATE , ORG convicted the applicant of CARDINAL counts of drug offences and , in accordance with the provisions of inter alia Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW ( PERSON ) , sentenced him to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment of which CARDINAL were suspended pending a DATE period , and with deduction of the time spent in pre - trial detention . In addition , it imposed a fine of CARDINAL . In the determination of its sentence , ORG took into account that the applicant had never been convicted previously of a drug offence . Although the applicant could have filed an appeal against this judgment , he did not do so .

LAW ; “ ORG ” ) defines pre - trial detention ( voorlopige hechtenis ) as deprivation of liberty pursuant to an order for detention on remand ( inbewaringstelling ) , a warrant for the taking into pre - trial detention ( gevangenneming ) or an order for further detention on remand ( gevangenhouding ) . The statutory rules governing pre - trial detention are set out in ORG CARDINAL of the ORG .
LAW ORG reads as follows :
“ CARDINAL . An order for pre - trial detention can be issued in case of suspicion of :
( a ) an offence which , according to the law , carries a punishment of imprisonment of DATE or more ;

( b ) one of the offences defined in Articles CARDINAL , CARDINALc § CARDINAL , CARDINALd § CARDINAL , LAW § CARDINAL , QUANTITY , CARDINAL § CARDINAL , CARDINALb , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINALa , CARDINAL , ORG , CARDINALc , CARDINAL and CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Criminal Code ;
( c ) one of the offences defined in :
- LAW , part b , of the DATE Road Traffic Act ( ORG ) ;
- LAW ( GPE buitengewone bevoegdheden burgerlijk gezag ) ;
- Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL § CARDINAL and DATE of ORG ( Conscientious Objectors ) Act ( GPE militaire dienst ) ;
- LAW ( Wet op de kansspelen ) ;
- LAW ;
- LAW ( QUANTITY wapens en munitie ) ;
- LAW ( LANGUAGE toezicht effectenverkeer ) .

CARDINAL . The order can further be issued if no permanent address or place of residence of the suspect in the GPE can be established and he is suspected of an offence within the jurisdiction of the regional courts and which , according to the law , is punishable by imprisonment .
CARDINAL . The previous paragraphs are only applied when it appears from the facts or circumstances that there are serious indications against the suspect . ”
Article PERSON of the ORG reads :
“ CARDINAL . An order based on LAW can only be issued :
a. if it is apparent from particular behaviour displayed by the suspect , or from particular circumstances concerning him personally , that there is a serious danger of absconding ;
b. if it is apparent from particular circumstances that there is a serious reason of public safety requiring the immediate deprivation of liberty .
CARDINAL . For the application of the preceding paragraph , only the following can be considered as a serious reason of public safety :

- CARDINAL . if it concerns suspicion of commission of an act which , according to the law , carries a punishment of imprisonment of DATE or more and the legal order has been seriously rocked by that act ;

- CARDINAL . if there is a serious risk the suspect will commit an offence which , according to the law , carries a prison sentence of DATE or more or whereby the security of the ORG or the health or safety of persons may be endangered , or give rise to a general danger to goods ;

- CARDINAL . if it concerns suspicion of CARDINAL of the offences defined in ORG CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINALa , CARDINAL , ORG , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE or CARDINAL of the Criminal Code , whereas DATE have passed since DATE on which , on account of CARDINAL of these offences , the suspect has been irrevocably sentenced to a punishment or measure entailing deprivation of liberty , a measure entailing restriction of liberty or community service , and there is further a serious risk that the suspect will again commit CARDINAL of those offences ;
- CARDINAL . if pre - trial detention is reasonably necessary for discovering the truth otherwise than through statements of the suspect .

CARDINAL . An order for pre - trial detention shall not be issued if there are serious prospects that , in case of a conviction , no irrevocable custodial sentence or a measure entailing deprivation of liberty will be imposed on the suspect , or that he , by the enforcement of the order , would be deprived of his liberty for a longer period than the duration of the custodial sentence or measure . ”

Orders for pre - trial detention are immediately enforceable ( LAW ORG ) . Pre - trial detention in the form of an order for detention on remand of a suspect may be issued by the investigating judge for a maximum duration of DATE ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the ORG ) .

Under LAW ORG , a subsequent prolongation of pre - trial detention may be ordered by ORG in the form of an order for further detention on remand for a maximum duration of DATE . In case the trial proceedings have not started within the CARDINAL days’ validity of an order for further detention on remand , ORG can prolong it twice , each time for a maximum of DATE ( LAW ORG ) .
LAW ORG reads :

“ An order for pre - trial detention may be lifted by ORG . It may do so of its own motion or upon the request of the suspect , or DATE in so far as it concerns an order for ... further detention on remand DATE upon a proposal from the investigating judge or a request by the public prosecutor . ”
Article CARDINAL of LAW , in so far as relevant , states :
“ CARDINAL . Within a maximum of DATE after its execution , the suspect may file an appeal with ORG against a decision of ORG ordering further detention on remand ...

CARDINAL . Within the same time - limit , the suspect may file an appeal against an extension of an order for further detention on remand , but only if no appeal has been filed by him against the order for further detention on remand or against a previous prolongation order ... ”
Article QUANTITY of the ORG , in so far as relevant , provides :

“ CARDINAL . The suspect , who has requested for the first time to suspend ( schorsing ) or to lift ( opheffing ) an order for pre - trial detention , may file an appeal with ORG against a negative decision on that request . The suspect , who has filed an appeal against a negative decision on a request for suspension , can not subsequently file an appeal against a negative decision on a request to lift a pre - trial detention order . The suspect , who has filed an appeal against a negative decision on a request to lift a pre - trial detention order , can not subsequently file an appeal against a negative decision on a request for suspension of pre - trial detention . ”
